g.text: Schema validation of the incoming message
Verify the message's signature (to be confirmed in future requirement)
The above validation steps are already handled by
the ML-Adapter for the open source implementation.
It may need to be added in future for custom adapters.
in the bulk using its reference
Validate that there are no duplicate individualTransfers
On failure, send bulk error message to Payer.
No further processing on individual transfers is done
The Specification doesn't touch on the duplicate handling
of bulk transfers, so the current design mostly follows the
strategy used for individual transfers, except in two places.
For duplicate requests where hash matches, the current design
includes only the status of the bulk & timestamp (if completed),
but not the individual transfers (for which a GET should be used).
For duplicate requests where hash matches but are not in a
finalized state, only the state of the bulkTransfer is sent.
Request to retrieve Hash for a bulkTransferId
Request Transfer Hash for a bulkTransferId
Generate Hash for the incoming message
Request to retrieve Bulk Transfer state
Publish Notification event for Payer with the completed bulk transfer
Publish Notification event for Payer with the completed bulk transfer
Send /error callback with appropriate error message
Request to retrieve Payer Participant details (if it exists)
Return Participant details if it exists
Return Participant details if it exists
Request to retrieve Payee Participant details (if it exists)
Return Participant details if it exists
Return Participant details if it exists
Persist Bulk Transfer State (with bulkTransferState='INVALID') (Introducing a new status INVALID to mark these entries)
Break down the bulk into individual transfers
Add elements such as Expiry time, Payer FSP, Payee FSP, etc. to each
transfer to make their format similar to a single transfer
[for every individual transfer in the bulk]
in the bulk using the reference
Request to persist bulk transfer association
Route & Publish Prepare event to the Payer for the Individual Transfer
